titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Teunis D. Huntting genealogical records of Long Island families 1980.005
titlestmt.author: John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:15:06 +0000.

did.unittitle: Teunis D. Huntting genealogical records of Long Island families
did.abstract: This collection contains Teunis G. Huntting's papers on the genealogy of Long Island families, which was copied from the church records of East Hampton, New York. The volume was assembled circa 1880 to 1900, and the genealogical information included within dates from the 18th and 19th centuries. It includes the following families: Baker, Barns, Conklin, Darbe, Dayton, Dimon, Edwards, Filer, Fithian, Hand, Hedges, Hicks, Hopping, Huntting, Jones, Miller, Mulford, Murdock, Osborn, Paine, Parsons, Schellinger, Sherrill, Stratton, and Talmage.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional genealogies and family papers can be found by searching for specific surnames in our finding aids database at https://specialcollections.library.nyu.edu/search/catalog, and by searching our library catalog at http://bobcat.library.nyu.edu/primo_library/libweb/action/search.do?vid=BHS.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Teunis D. Huntting genealogical records of Long Island families, 1980.005, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Immediate source of acquisition unknown. Accessioned in 1980.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains Teunis G. Huntting's papers on the genealogy of Long Island families, which was copied from the church records of East Hampton, New York. The volume was assembled circa 1880 to 1900, and the genealogical information included within dates from the 18th and 19th centuries.

It includes the following families: Baker, Barns, Conklin, Darbe, Dayton, Dimon, Edwards, Filer, Fithian, Hand, Hedges, Hicks, Hopping, Huntting, Jones, Miller, Mulford, Murdock, Osborn, Paine, Parsons, Schellinger, Sherrill, Stratton, and Talmage.
